text: The project will ____  the internal floor area of the building
howMeasured: This might be done by, for example, adding or removing additional floors.

text: The project _____ alter the external appearance of the building
info: Any works that will materially alter the external appearance of the building will require planning permission, unless they fall under a form of permitted development.
policyRef: Town and Country Planning Act 1990 Section 55

info: If you wish to divide up your property into two (for example creating self-contained living accommodation or a self-contained office for business use) then a planning application may be required.
policyRef: Town and Country Planning Act 1990, Section 55 (2B)

info: Adding an extension or an outbuilding to a flat (even if it is located on the ground floor, or has a roof terrace) will require planning permission.

text: Is any part of the property listed?
info: If any part of the property is listed, Listed Building Consent will be required.

text: Are there any protected trees on the property?
